title: APLD vs. Sandisk: Which Data Infrastructure Stock is the Better Buy?
text: SNDK's technology advantage and improving profitability contrast with Applied Digital's capital-intensive model. Storage leader benefits from the AI infrastructure wave.

title: Palantir Stock vs. Sandisk Stock: Wall Street Says Buy One and Sell the Other
text: In 2025, Palantir stock advanced 135%, and Sandisk shares climbed 559% as the artificial intelligence trade continued to drive the market. Palantir is a leader in artificial intelligence and machine learning platforms, but it is also one of the most expensive software stocks in history.

title: Are Data Storage Stocks in a Bubble or Should You Get in Now?
text: The AI buildout is creating a supply-demand imbalance in storage devices. Prices of DRAM and NAND storage devices soared in 2025.

title: Billionaire Stanley Druckenmiller Sells Broadcom Stock and Buys an AI Stock Up 1,000% Since Early 2025
text: Stanley Druckenmiller sold Broadcom and bought Sandisk in the third quarter, exchanging one semiconductor company for another. Broadcom is the market leader in Ethernet networking chips and custom AI accelerators, and the stock looks cheap compared to forward earnings estimates.

title: Sandisk: The NAND Trade Is Getting Crowded Heading Into Q2 Earnings
text: Sandisk has been obliterating the Street's revenue and EPS expectations. I see a similar pattern in earnings revisions to what Nvidia experienced in mid 2023. I believe a 2026 NAND pricing upcycle should flow straight into SanDisk's average selling prices and gross margins. Q3 FY26 guidance matters most in the upcoming earnings release. A midpoint guide above the Street's $2.72B revenue and $3.84 EPS would signal a faster hyperscaler ramp.
